lexUnit.name: vase.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a decorative container without handles, typically made of glass or china and used as an ornament or for displaying cut flowers.

sentence.text: Bunny dropped the lighter into a china vase in the cocktail cabinet in the prop-room and burnt the letter on the fire .
A small heavy porcelain vase on a side table caught his eye .
She put out a hand to touch one of the ribbed blue and yellow vases on the marble mantelpiece .
Mrs Wright lifted a vase of flowers that was on a small table by the door so that she could see how much water was in .
As a final touch , you might like to place a vase of fresh flowers in the room ; this will greatly enhance the atmosphere .
She stood near a great vase of dried grasses and leaves and her dress was something flowery .
A vase of white lilies stands on the table ; the decanter is a silvered jug of water only .
Elinor read the cards from two identical large vases of lilies which took up all the space on the dressing table .
The next moment Ronni was being led inside , into a huge tiled entrance hall with a round central table weighed down by an enormous vase of fresh flowers .
She did n't trust the captain , so we were there to ensure her vases were carefully loaded and no pilfering went on .
` I like your jade vase , Rokeya , " she said .
Fine by me , I said , distributing ashtrays and bud vases .
He smashed her cut-glass vase against the wall , not caring how much noise he made .
On it were a variety of jugs and china vases from the same school of design as the pixie doorknocker .
He pulled out a blue Ming vase which , after a preliminary dousing with water , appeared as good as new after its four centuries of burial .
The identical type is used on fifth-century vases and small terra cotta reliefs for Penelope or occasionally Electra .
On the dresser , there was a fluted crystal vase , filled with sprays of beautifully scented freesias , and she went over to sniff them appreciatively .
Her popularity was obvious when so many colleagues gathered for her farewell presentation at which she was given a crystal vase and some luggage as a leaving present .
There were a couple of oriental rugs on the tiled floor , old maps , comfortable armchairs and sofas , flower vases which tactfully avoided the awfulness of Italian ceramics .
Both pictures depict a glass vase set on a stone plinth with variegated tulips , daffodils , irises and other flowers .
Some of the stone vases were partially coated with gold leaf .
By its side was Carla 's mug , also empty , and a dozen roses arranged in a vase .
Letterman has filled his suite with striking vases of flowers .
She was going to put it in the china vase , only one of the stage hands had left his lighter there for safe keeping , so she stuffed it between two books on the top shelf .
